chapters.title: The Horror in Clay - Part 1
chapters.text: Francis Wayland Thurston begins uncovering the strange legacy of his grand-uncle, Professor Angell, through mysterious documents and a strange bas-relief sculpture tied to a cult worshiping a being called Cthulhu.

chapters.title: The Horror in Clay - Part 2
chapters.text: Thurston investigates the artist Henry Wilcox’s dreams and their alignment with a global pattern of disturbances and shared visions, suggesting an otherworldly influence awakening in people’s minds.

chapters.title: The Tale of Inspector Legrasse - Part 1
chapters.text: Inspector Legrasse recounts the 1908 police raid on a cult in Louisiana. He discovers a monstrous idol and learns of the cult’s belief in ancient, cosmic entities that predate humanity.

chapters.title: The Tale of Inspector Legrasse - Part 2
chapters.text: Further parallels emerge between Legrasse’s findings and the bas-relief sculpture, linking Wilcox’s dreams to a broader, global cult connected to Cthulhu and his cosmic influence.

chapters.title: The Madness from the Sea - Part 1
chapters.text: Thurston reads a sailor’s diary describing a terrifying encounter with the sunken city of R’lyeh, where Cthulhu momentarily awakens. This firsthand account deepens the horror.

chapters.title: The Madness from the Sea - Part 2
chapters.text: As the story concludes, all the disparate threads converge — dreams, artifacts, and encounters — suggesting that Cthulhu still dreams and waits beneath the sea, ready to return.
